comments.body: it'll be interesting to see how executor port resources will fit into this mold. not a problem that we have to solve here, just food for thought.
This comment is out of date.
should also note that `mesos.Offer.Resources` may be modified by a procurement func

interesting to note that someone in the MESOS community is working on some changes to allow a framework to request additional resources for tasks (MESOS-938). seems like something that would complement this TODO
In fact, I was just thinking about accepting offers with resources between request and limit, as a fallback. But of course something dynamic would be even better.
IMO this does not belong into the procurement. Can we move that back into the caller? It modified t.executor, not only t.spec.

Agree, this feels dirty. I'll see what the impact is of extacting this bit
into the caller.

I don't really like it in the caller either. If anything is going to manipulate the internal state of the task object, I'd rather it live in podtask
This will go away with my "decouple executor + kubelet" patch. Then the kubelet will know from the SlaveInfo who it is.

Yes, but will kube-proxy? In master they've updated kube-proxy to generate
events to the apiserver, and kube-proxy needs this value.

Why does it need it? Isn't it the same value as the hostname in the SlaveInfo?
Which is connected to the question how to get the SlaveInfo hostname and other info to the minion to start kube-proxy and later the kubelet...
kube-proxy probably needs to use the same hostname as the kubelet when reporting events. i don't know what happens if it doesn't, other than probably confusing an operator looking at the event logs

this is also a change outside of t.spec. Not sure I like it here.

We could create a deep copy of t.Pod in t.Spec to clean this up.

Agree, but I think we should do that in a follow-up PR. I suspect such a
change will lead to unintended breakage and will require additional effort
that I don't think we should take on here. I'll add a TODO stating that we
should refactor this.
